intro: Ecbolium retusum, commonly known as the rough ecbolium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. Ecbolium retusum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
